text: Coats House is a historic home located at Tarboro, Edgecombe County, North Carolina. It was built about 1860, and is a two-story, three bays wide, English Cottage style brick dwelling. It features a hipped roof with wide, overhanging eaves and a cupola and four interior end chimneys. Also on the property are the contributing brick kitchen and a frame smokehouse. Its builder, Thomas H. Coats, also built the Calvary Episcopal Church and First Baptist Church in Raleigh, North Carolina. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973. It is located in the Tarboro Historic District. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1860 Category:Houses in Edgecombe County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Edgecombe County, North Carolina Category:Historic district contributing properties in North Carolina Category:Individually listed contributing properties to historic districts on the National Register in North Carolina Category:1860 establishments in North Carolina
title: Coats House
